announcement.goals.starexpress.starstruc: Reveal your true power at the perfect moment.
guidebook.role.creator: By
guidebook.role.description.wathe:civilia: A mere bystander, the Civilian has arrived on the train unarmed. This role has absolutely nothing in its arsenal.
guidebook.role.description.wathe:vigilan: Armed with a gun, even upon first boarding the train. Their sole mission is to rid the Harpy Express of anyone with malicious intentions.
guidebook.role.description.wathe:killer:
A passenger with the intent of ridding the world of everyone who isn't like them. Their sole mission is to kill every non-killer player.

Maybe they have daddy issues.
guidebook.role.description.starexpress:s:
A peaceful passenger blessed with otherworldly abilities created to aid them, yet cause them to stick out like a sore thumb.

Once every 90 seconds, the Starstruck can activate their ability and gain both instinct and heavily faster movement speed for 15 seconds, but the sudden transformation will emit power that gives their true role away.

Upon completing their current task, the Starstruck's ability cooldown will be decreased by 5 seconds.
guidebook.role.description.noellesroles::
The Jester has come from a far-off kingdom, having expended their time as their king's servant. They now seek to play one final trick that will go down in history.

Upon being shot, the Jester will enter Psycho Mode (much like the ability Killers can purchase), causing bodies to hit the floor wherever they pass by.

Thankfully, other than that, they cannot inflict any damage themselves. Still, think before you shoot!

The Executioner has boarded the Harpy Express awaiting a specific passenger's demise.

While they cannot inflict any damage themselves, they have access to a plethora of tools to toy with their victim.

As long as their victim does not fall to a passenger the Executioner may wish to work with, when the victim dies, the Executioner will become a random killer role.

Interestingly, the Executioner does not have Instinct, nor can they see who is a killer alongside them until their target is executed.

The Morphling is a killer who has mastered the art of imitation. They have the unique ability to disguise themselves to appear as any other living passenger on the Harpy Express.

If the passenger that they are disguised as dies, their disguise will be removed, and they will be revealed as their proper self.

Morphlings will often target passengers who cannot speak, as their voice does not change while they are disguised.

The Phantom has the ability to sneak around undetected- their ability allows them to turn invisible for a short period of time every 90 seconds.

While their body is undetectable, anything they hold is still visible to the naked eye.

Phantoms will often choose to break into rooms and wait inside them, ready for a victim they can kill while hidden out of sight.

The Swapper is a killer who may or may not have smuggled a modified portal gun onto the Harpy Express. They have the ability to swap any player with any other player, thus teleporting both players to the other's location.

While Swappers are more of a mentally disorienting role to deal with, they make a devious pair when alongside a Jester or another killer in Psycho Mode, as hiding from them is fairly difficult.

While not a killer immediately, Vultures hunger for flesh and bone, and once they are satisfied, another killer will arrive on the train.

Once the Vulture has "Consumed" enough bodies (by using their ability while looking at a body), they will become a random killer role.

Vultures can be seen by other killer roles as a cohort, but the Vulture cannot see who else is a killer.

When a Vulture consumes a carcass, they will be slowed down for just the tiniest moment, and a sound cue will play. Keep a keen ear out and you may be able to make the predator the prey!
guidebook.role.noellesroles:the_insane_d: The Insane Damned Paranoid Killer Of Doom Death Destruction And Waffles
guidebook.role.description.noellesroles:: uhm guys help the voices are telling me to jump off the train

The Conductor is the driver of the Harpy Express, and thus, they have access to every room on the train.

The Conductor holds a Master Key, which grants the ability to open every door on the Harpy Express. This item is dropped on death, and killers can pick the keys up too, so protect them at all costs!

The Bartender has been studying the art of drinks for a long time. They have a keen eye, and can see poisoned food/drink trays.

The Bartender also gains 50 coins per task completed. These coins can be used to purchase Defense Vials, which can be slipped into snacks or drinks to give the next drinker immunity to one attack.

Remember that killers can become immune too- make sure you trust whoever you give a drink to!

The Noisemaker was devoid of attention as a child.
Laugh at this attention seeker, everyone!

The Noisemaker's body will glow upon meeting their demise. They also gain 50 coins per task completed and 5 coins at passive intervals, which can be used to purchase Firecrackers.

The Recaller used to be a bank robber- but now they've gone good, and they're trying to lay low for a while. They've still got a knack for escaping dangerous situations, though.

The Recaller can set a location by using their ability, then teleport back to that location by using their ability again.
Teleporting costs 100 coins, and the Recaller gains 50 coins per task completed.

Recallers are one of the only roles that can counter most, if not all, dangerous situations. This is, however, limited by their reaction time.
The Coroner has the ability to read dead bodies like scrolls. They can figure out how and when passengers perished just by glimpsing their body, along with what role the passenger was.

While Voodoos are a profession often laughed at, this Voodoo in particular does have real abilities.

The Voodoo can pick one player to be brought down with them- if the Voodoo perishes, their selected player will die alongside them.

Voodoos can change their target once every 30 seconds.

The Mimic is a spy, pretending to be a killer alongside one of their friends (who may or may not be a convicted murderer on the run).

The Mimic appears as a Killer Cohort to other killers, but only has a fake knife.

If an alliance is forged with the Mimic, you could gain some high ground over any killers aboard the Harpy Express.

*blows up pancakes with MIND*



yeah this is just a civilian with a bunch of notes lol

If Vigilantes are so awesome, why haven't they made Vigilante 2 yet?

Spawns with a grenade instead of a gun.

I'd say "With great power comes great responsibility" or something corny like that, but honestly this role usually just bombs everyone around them as soon as the round starts.

Go kill some idiots for me.
-Stargazer <3

Your in-game height is set to reflect your real-life height.

Yeah, you're short now. Deal with it, sucker.

This passenger is somehow part Chameleon. How does Urbanshade keep coming up with this stuff??!

Standing still will slowly cause you to blend into your surroundings. Moving causes you to appear visible again.

The Guesser has the ability to pick any non-killer player and attempt to guess their role. If they guess correctly, the victim dies immediately.

This modifier can only be assigned to killers.
guidebook.role.description.stupid_expres:
A Neutral role that has arrived on the train with the ability to carry on any one person's legacy, even after death.

While the Amnesiac begins each game as a true neutral role, if they come across a dead body, they have the choice to "Imitate" the body's role, thus becoming it themselves.
The Amnesiac can only do this once, as imitating a role removes the Amnesiac role from themselves.

The Arsonist has managed to smuggle both a Jerry Can and a Lighter onto the Harpy Express alongside themselves. Their only mission? Have some fun- at the expense of other passengers' lives.

The Arsonist can douse players in oil with their Jerry Can.
Upon dousing at least 30% of other passengers, they gain the ability to ignite the doused players, killing them instantly- regardless of their alignment.

The Necromancer has been practicing the dark arts for years of their life. They have gained the ability to bring the dead back and manipulate them to do their bidding.

Once every three minutes, the Necromancer can interact with a body to bring them back to life as a killer. The revived player's role is chosen randomly out of all enabled killer roles.
This can also result in the creation of a second Necromancer.

The Avaricious is essentially the Killer's extroverted cousin.
While their shop consists of the standard Killer's products, the only way the Avaricious can gain coins is by being around other players when their "Payout" occurs.

Payouts are given every minute, and the Avaricious will receive 10 coins per player in a 5.5-block radius around themselves upon this occurring.

Lovers are linked with heart and soul. If one falls, the other will feel a disturbance in the force- and immediately follow suit.

Lovers always appear in pairs- either a Civilian-Civilian or Civilian-Killer bond is formed. It is allegedly impossible for two killers to fall for each other.

If this modifier is enabled, two players are always chosen to be Lovers.

The Allergic's medical record has proven that they have severe weaknesses- upon either eating or drinking, they may suffer severe side-effects.

The Allergic's allergy type is randomly chosen upon the modifier being assigned.

Upon consuming their affected consumable type, the Allergic will receive one of the following effects:
- Nothing (3/6 chance)
- 3 seconds of Instinct (1/6 chance)
- Immunity to the next attack (1/6 chance)
- Immunity-bypassing Poison (1/6 chance)

If this modifier is enabled, there is a 1/3 chance for a random player to be assigned an Allergy.
It seems that it is impossible for a Lover to also be Allergic.
